'''''Oliphaunt''''' is the title of a short comic poem about the [[Oliphaunts|beast]] quoted by the hobbit [[Samwise Gamgee]] to [[Gollum]] as they and [[Frodo Baggins]] rested in the dell before the [[Morannon]].<ref>{{TT|IV3}}</ref>  It was a piece of traditional bestiary lore of the [[Shire-hobbits]].<ref>{{ATB|Preface}}</ref>

==Poem excerpt==
<poem style="font-style:italic; margin-left:20px;">Grey as a mouse,
Big as a house,
Nose like a snake,
I make the earth shake,
As I tramp through the grass;
Trees crack as I pass.<ref>{{AB|Oliphaunt}}</ref></poem>

==Other versions of the legendarium==
An early version of the poem was published as '''Iumbo, or ye Kinde of ye Oliphaunt''' in ''[[The Stapeldon Magazine#June 1927|''The Stapeldon Magazine'']]'', Oxford, vol. 7, no. 40 in June 1927 on pages 125-127.<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.tolkienbooks.net/php/details.php?reference=13290|articlename=Stapeldon Magazine. 1927|dated=|website=TB|accessed=6 April 2014}}</ref>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
'''2024: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim]]'':'''
:At one point in the film, it is mentioned that the [[Rohan]] has a poem about Oliphaunts, implying that the [[Rohirrim]] are either aware of the Hobbit poem or that they have their own variation of the Hobbit poem.
